SpeakerInfo.div: zōt ud rāspīg: Kotwal und Boyd; zōt: Anklesaria.

RecitationInstruction.ab: aṣ̌əm. vohū. III gwptn'] aṣ̌əm. vohū. ... vahištāi. aṣ̌əm. aṣ̌əm. vōhū. III gwptn' 400; aṣ̌əm. vohū. ... vahištāi. aṣ̌əm. 410.

Nerangs.ab: barsom frōd ō ī barsomdān nihišn aṣ̌əm vohū
"He should put the barsom on the barsomdān (and then recite:)"

ModernPractice.ab: "While reciting (the zōt̰) all the three Aṣ̌əm Vohū, the chief priest circles the bundle with both hands over the moon-shaped stands. The assistant priest puts fragrant incense on the fire."

"(zōt and rāspī) recite in unison ashem a. v.3, with emphasis given to "righteousness" ( ashem). With each recitation the zōt repeats the gesture of touching the tip of the barsom to the crescent shaped stands."
